privacyStatement: By signing up you accept the
resetPasswordInstruction: A reset password link has been sent to your email. Click on that link to set a new password.
legacyMigrateDescription: You are trying to upgrade from a version that is too old to migrate automatically. You need to perform the following steps to migrate manually.
legacyImportWarning: This will replace your existing configuration. Make sure you have backed up your configuration. Do you want to proceed?
legacyMigrateStep3: Step 3: Exit and relaunch the App
freeVersionDesc: You can buy PRO version to remove adds and encourage development.
proVersionDesc: Thank you very much for purchasing the app. This encourage our development.
rateAppDesc: If you like the app please provide a positive rating. It will motivate us to continue the project.
batteryOptimizationSettingsUnavailable: Battery optimization settings is not available
disableBackgroundRunAlert: Background service will be terminated when the app exited using the Back button. Pressing the Home or Recent button will keep the app running in the background. This is applicable to gesture navigation too.
backgroundRunForPermission: Background service only works when notification is enabled. Please enable notification from settings and then restart the app.
errorPageMessage1: Sorry, an unexpected error has occurred.
errorPageMessage2: If you are launching the app using shortcut, it might not be valid anymore. Please recreate the dashboard shortcut.
errorPageMessage3: This error also could be due to the corrupted data or configuration. If it is occuring for a particular Connection or Dashboard or Panel please delete it and try after reconfiguring again.
errorPageMessage4: If the issue still persist you can wipeout all data for this application and configure from the begening.
connectionsListEmpty: You do not have any connection to communicate with MQTT broker. If you are using this application for the first time, we highly recomend to go through FAQ and User Guide from main menu.
connectionDeleteMessage: Are you sure that you want to delete the connection setup. All associated dashboards and panels will be lost.
rateAppDialogTitle: How about a rating on the App Store, then?
leaveCommentDialogTitle: Would you mind giving us some feedback?
cloneConnectionContent: Duplicate client id may cause connection termination. Leave it blank to generate randomly.
shareDisclaimer: Note: You can send or receive dashboards under this connection via MQTT. Remember, while receiving all exsisting dashboards will be replaced.
shareVersionMismatch: Configuration can not be shared between two different version application. Please update both the application and try again.
dashboardPrefixHelp: Optional prefix for this dashboard. Useful for public broker
setConnectionHomeHelp: Choosing this option will allow the dashboard open by default when you select a connection
clientIdHelp: Enter client-id or leave blank for randomly generate
hostAddressHelp: DNS/IP address of MQTT broker. e.g. test.mosquitto.org or 192.168.1.5
networkHelp: You can choose TCP(default) or Websocket connection. For encrypted secure connection with certificate choose SSL. Usally ports for TCP, TCP (SSL), Websocket and Websocket (SSL) are 1883, 8883, 8080 and 8081.
certHelp: Add crt/pem certificate path for SSL. You can provide ca or self-signed certificate. Due to the Android scope storage limitation, this file will get copied to app's internal storage. For additional info please refer User Guide.
disableHostnameCheckWarning: Warning: The certificate subject alternative names will not be verified.
allowUntrustCACertificateWarning: Warning: The broker identity will not be verified.
caCettificateHelp: You can use your self signed CA certificate here. Please refer Help and FAQ section to know how to generate one.
clientCertificateHelp: You can use PKCS12 certificate for client authentication. If you have the Client Certificate and Private Key separately, generate this certificate using OpenSSL. The export password must not be empty and use OpenSSL version 1.1 or -legacy flag to generate it properly. Please refer to the Help and FAQ section to know more about it.
name: Name
usernamePasswordHelp: Optional username and password for authentication
dashboardDeleteFailMessage: You can not delete the home dashboard of a connection. Make another dashboard as connection home and then delete this dashboard.
scanModuleInstalled: Google Barcode Scanner installed. You can scan now.
scanModuleInstallFailed: Failed to install Google Barcode Scanner. Retry after updating Google Play Service.
The Google Barcode Scanner Module is not: Scan module is not ready yet. Try after sometime.
exportDataNotAllowed: Export data is allowed on pro version only
shareConfigNotAllowed: Share config is allowed on pro version only
panelDeleteConfirmation: Are you sure that you want to delete this panel?
panelDataDeleteConfirmation: Are you sure that you want to delete persisted data for this panel?
panelListEmpty: Current dashboard does not have any panel
invalidShortcut: Obsolete shortcut, please regenerate a new one
dashboardDeleteConfirmMessage: Are you sure that you want to delete this dashboard. All associated panels will be lost.
panelInfoButton: Press Button to publish pre-configured payload.
panelInfoSwitch: Publish payload to turn on or off appliances. It also subscribes to the topic to monitor its state.
panelInfoSlider: Publish a number from a configured range and subscribes topic to display state.
panelInfoComboBox: Publish and Subscribe to a payload from a pre-configured list. Use this panel over Radio Button panel where the list is large.
panelInfoRadioButtons: Publish and Subscribe to a payload from a pre-configured list. Use this panel over the Combo Box panel where the list is small.
panelInfoLEDIndicator: Subscribes a topic and displays on or off state. This is a read-only panel. To publish payload use Switch panel.
panelInfoMultistateIndicator: Subscribes a topic and display state if it matches with a pre-configured payload list. This is a read-only panel. To publish payload use Combo Box or Radio Button panel.
panelInfoProgress: Subscribes a topic and display progress on a horizontal, vertical or circular bar. This is a read-only panel. To publish payload use Slider panel.
panelInfoGauge: Subscribes a topic and display progress on a gauge. It can be configured with 3 different colors which will change depending on the payload.
panelInfoTextInput: Publishes any message from a text box to a preconfigured topic.
panelInfoTextLog: This panel subscribes to a topic and displays its payload. Wildcard subscription is allowed for this panel. It can be configured to display all payload received or the latest message.
panelInfoColorPicker: Displays a color swatch to choose and publish a color in HEX or RGB format.
panelInfoDateTimePicker: Displays a date and time picker to choose and publish. It also allows publishing current date and time on a single tap.
panelInfoLineGraph: Plots payload value in realtime. Multiple topics can be plotted in a single graph.
panelInfoBarGraph: Plots latest payload of one or more topics in a single bar graph.
panelInfoChart: Plots latest payload of multiple topics in a pie or donut chart.
panelInfoImageViewer: Displays image from a static URL or received by MQTT
panelInfoBarcodeScanner: Scans Barcode or QR code and publishes the decoded value
panelInfoURILauncher: Subscribes a topic and on pressing launch button latest URL is opened in an appropriate application e.g. Browser, Map, etc.
panelInfoNodeStatus: It helps to display if a remote device e.g. ESP32 or Raspberry Pi is connected to the broker. Remember this panel does not work out of the box. The remote device must publish an online payload after connecting and it should configure offline payload as will message with retain flag true. Also tapping on the status icon manual sync request can be published.
panelInfoLayoutDecorator: This panel is for visual decoration purposes only. It helps to create a header for multiple panels combined.
addTimePickerPanelTitle: Add a Date Time Picker panel
discardMessage: Are you sure you want to discard the changes?
disableDashboardPrefixHelp: Dashboard prefix automatically gets prepended to the panel topic. Disable it to exclude this panel.
maxPersistenceHelp: Max number of persisted messages when app runs in background
maxDuraionHelp: Data points will not be visible beyond this duration
smoothCurveHelp: The graph line will be smoothed instead of a straight line. Enabling it will cost performance degradation for a larger number of data points.
payloadMaxGtMin: Max value must be greter than min value
payloadMaxNotEqMin: Max and min value must not be equal
notificationMessageHelp: Define the message you want to show in the notification. The payload value can be replaced by <payload> placeholder.
notificationHelp: This feature is available only in pro version
noWildcardNotification: Notification is not available for wildcard
layoutDecoratorFormDesc: This panel neither subscribe nor publishes any data. This panel is for decoration purpose only. It is useful to create header label for combo panels.
hidePanelNameWarning: Panel name will not be visible to this panel
jsonPathHelp: Provide JsonPath to parse the JSON data from received message. Please refer userguide for usage details.
jsonEnvelopeHelp: You can wrap publish messages to JSON formate. Please refer userguide for usage details. Valid replaceable variables are {{options}}
seperateSubscribeTopicHelp: Provide subscribe topic if you wish to use different one from publish topic. Leave it blank to use same with publish topic.
noPayloadHelp: Message published without payload. This is sometime helpfule to clear the retained message from broker.
payloadOnBtnRelease: Provide a payload if you wish to publish two separate payloads while button press and release
confirmationMessageHelp: Define the message you want to show in the confirmation box. The payload value can be replaced by <payload> placeholder.
Shortcut is not supported: Shortcut is not supported on this device
excludeBrokerInfoDetails: This will exclude the broker address, client ID, username, and password from each connection while exporting the configuration.
backupDisclaimer: Backup will export configuration and it can be shared to setup a new device quickly. Exported configuration is an unencrypted plain text file which contains sensitive information e.g. broker username and password. Do not share this file to unauthorized person. Also note, the certificate files will not be exported. You have to manually take backup those files.
randomizeClientId: Same client-id for different MQTT client may terminate connection automatically. Do you want to generate client-id randomly for each connection?
invalidSchemaWarning: The JSON schema validation failed. This could be due to invalid data or version mismatch. If you proceed you might encounter with a configuration issue. We highly recommend exporting current settings as a backup before import. Do you still want to continue import?
clientIdConflictDisclaimer: Same client ID in multiple app will create re-connecting in loop. Regenerate random client ID to avoid it.
profileDeleteMessage: Are you sure you want to delete your account? Once it is deleted, you won't be able to use the app until your admin reconfigure the app for you.
emailVerificationDesc: A verification email is sent to you. Please check your email and follow the instructions.
adminApprovalDesc1: Your email is verified, please reach out to your admin to add you as a team member.
adminApprovalDesc2: If you are an admin and want to create your team please reach out to us over email.
noAdminProfileTitle: You do not have a profile
noAdminProfileDesc1: You do not have a configuration profile. Please add your profile to your team.
noAdminProfileDesc2: As you are an admin, you also can impersonate your team members without creating your profile.
profileDisableDesc1: Your account is disabled by your admin. Please reach out to your admin to re-enable it.
profileDisableDesc2: If you want to switch your admin you can delete your profile and re-create the account with new admin.
userGuideDesc: For detailed information and help refer the User Guide. If you have any question or find any bug or want a new feature please leave a comment in our blog.
faqPlafromQ: On which platforms is this app available?
faqPlafromA: This app is available on Android and iOS.
faqPrivacyA: This application neither collects any data nor shares it with any third party. All data and user preferences are kept in local memory. However, the user can export his preferences at any time which may contain sensitive information and it is his responsibility to keep the exported data safe. Also, this app displays ads from Google AdSense and they can collect your data. It is mandatory to show data collection consent for AdSense. Please refer to Google AdSense's privacy policy for more info about the ads. If you wish to avoid the data collection consent please consider the PRO version.
faqProtocolsA: This app supports MQTT (TCP) and Websocket protocol.
faqSecurityA: Yes, it supports TLS. In iOS you can only use certificates provided by trusted CA. While in Android you use a trusted CA certificate or self-signed x509 certificate for encryption. Using Linux OpenSSL the certificate can be generated using the following command.
faqClientCertificateQ: Does it support client certificate for authentication?
faqClientCertificateA: Yes, it supports client-side authentication using PKCS12 certificate. If you have the Client Certificate and Private Key separately, generate this certificate using OpenSSL. The export password must not be empty and use OpenSSL version 1.1 or -legacy flag. Otherwise, the certificate may not be imported properly. Use the following command in the terminal to generate it.
faqWildCardA: Yes, it supports wildcard subscription where ever it is applicable (e.g. Log panel).
faqDataTypeQ: What is the datatype of the payload?
faqDataTypeA: To keep the app simple all payloads are implemented as string type.
faqJsonASubscribe: You can parse received messages using simple JsonPath. The supported JsonPath are listed below.
faqJsonAPathAll: Wildcard matching all objects/elements regardless their names
faqJsonAPathUnion: Union operator for alternate names or array indices as a set
faqJsonAPathFilter: Applies a filter (script) expression via static evaluation
faqJsonAPathNote: Note: Only single quote is supported inside JsonPath expression. Script expressions inside of JSONPath locations are not recursively evaluated by JsonPath. Only the global $ and local @ symbols are expanded by a simple regular expression. This application does not validate JsonPath you provided. In case JsonPath is invalid or it does not match with any data it simply gets ignored. For debugging please use the Text and Log Panel.
faqJsonAPublish: You can wrap publish data into a JSON format. For example, you have configured {"kitchen": {"fan": "<payload>"}} as JSON pattern. Now if you set slider value to 10, then <payload> will be replaced by 10 and finally {"kitchen": {"fan": "10"}} will be published. You can use number of replaceable variable like <timestamp>, <client-id> etc. depending on the context. To know all available variables, press the inline help button while configuring the panel.
faqJsonATest: You can test the JSON path with this third party website.
faqBackgroundQ: Can it run in background and auto connect itself?
faqBackgroundA: Yes, it can run in the background in Android and auto-connect itself if the connection is lost. On iOS it can run continuously if it is running in the foreground and the "Keep screen on" setting is turned on.
faqNotificationA: The notification feature is available only on the Android Pro version. You can enable or disable notification of any panel.
faqDashboardPrefixA: When you configure dashboard prefix it will be automatically prepended to all panel's topic under the same dashboard. This is helpful for public broker. Please refer the User Guide for detailed explanation.
faqComboPanelA: Yes, you can visually combine same or different type panels. To combine panels use merge feature in panel option. This will remove panel border of a particular side and it will appear as a combo panel.
faqTimestampQ: Is it possible to display Sent and Received message timestamp?
faqTimestampA: Yes, you can turn on this feature for any panel. Remember this only shows timestamp in broker's perspective, i.e. it shows when the message is delivered to the broker or message delivered to mobile phone.
faqMaxStorageQ: What is the maximum limit of message storage?
faqMaxStorageA: For most of the panel, only the last message is relevant. However, some panels like Log and Line Graph can store previous messages. Each panel can store 1000 messages per topic.
faqSummary: I hope this FAQs are useful to you. For detailed information please refer User Guide. If you have any queries feel free to reach out to us at
